Package mpmToolbox.projectData.alignment

Class Alignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • mpmToolbox.projectData.alignment.Alignment
  • public class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object
    This class links all MSM note elements with expression data (milliseconds.date, milliseconds.date.end, velocity). It further provides a routine to render a visual representation of the piano roll.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

        generate a project data XML element

      • updateTiming

        public void updateTiming()
        Use this method when notes are un-fixed or fixed notes are silently repositioned. It recomputes the milliseconds timing of all notes.

      • updateTimingTransformation

        private void updateTimingTransformation()
        initialize the timing transformation based on the fixed notes of all the parts; invoke this method whenever up-to-date timing transformation data are to be processed

      • renderTiming

        private void renderTiming()
        apply the current timing transformation to all parts, so their notes get new millisecondsDates and millisecondsDateEnds

      • exportPerformance

        public meico.mpm.elements.Performance exportPerformance​(meico.mpm.elements.Performance performance)
        derive an MPM performance from the alignment data
        Parameters:
        performance - add the data to this performance, or set this null to generate a new performance
        Returns:
        the performance

      • importMsmPartsToPerformance

        private void importMsmPartsToPerformance​(meico.mpm.elements.Performance performance)
        helper method to export this alignment to an MPM performance
        Parameters:
        performance -

      • exportTiming

        private java.util.ArrayList<meico.mpm.elements.maps.GenericMap> exportTiming()
        Derives a global tempo and asynchrony maps from the alignment's timing transformation data. Be sure to execute this.updateTimingTransformation() before invoking this method!
        Returns:
        a list containing tempomap, asynchronymap

      • exportArticulation

        private void exportArticulation​(meico.mpm.elements.Performance performance)
        This method checks the millisecond on- and offsets of all notes in the alignment against their timing in the performance rendering. If correction is needed, it is done via a local articulation.
        Parameters:
        performance - the performance that will be refined with local articulation maps, if necessary

      • reposition

        public void reposition​(@NotNull
                       Note note,
                       double toMilliseconds)
        Sets a new milliseconds date and end date of the note and places it in the note sequence accordingly. The note is made fixed. The non-fixed notes are repositioned subsequently.
        Parameters:
        note - the note to be moved
        toMilliseconds - the new onset position of the note

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets the values of each note in each part to their initial values; the invoking application should also run recomputePianoRoll() to update the piano roll image

      • getLastNoteSounding

        public Note getLastNoteSounding()
        retrieve the last sounding note; if there are several, only one is returned
        Returns:
        the last sounding note or null

      • getCorrespondingTickDate

        public double[] getCorrespondingTickDate​(double milliseconds)
        Given a milliseconds date, compute the non-performed date from it according to this alignment. This is only an approximation.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds -
        Returns:
        since the parts can differ in timing, we can only return a range, i.e. a tuple [min, max]

      • getCorrespondingMillisecondsDate

        public double[] getCorrespondingMillisecondsDate​(double ticks)
        Given a tick date, compute the respective milliseconds date from it according to this alignment. This is only an approximation.
        Parameters:
        ticks -
        Returns:
        since the parts can differ in timing, we can only return a range, i.e. a tuple [min, max]

      • getMillisecondsLength

        public double getMillisecondsLength()
        compute the length of the alignment in milliseconds
        Returns:

      • scaleOverallTiming

        public void scaleOverallTiming​(double milliseconds)
        Scale the complete music to the specified length, i.e. the last milliseconds.date.end. This transformation is also applied to fixed notes!
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the milliseconds length to which the notes are scaled or null if no scaling is set

      • getPianoRoll

        Parameters:

        public PianoRoll getPianoRoll()

        Returns:
        the piano roll or null

      • recomputePianoRoll

        public PianoRoll recomputePianoRoll()

        Returns:
